meanings.definition: To strike or drive with great force
meanings.sent1: The angry bull was ramming its horns into the fence.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker was ramming the pile into the ground with a hammer.
meanings.sent3: The toddler kept ramming the square block into the round hole, thinking it would fit.
meanings.sent4: The storm was like a fierce giant ramming against the fragile boat.
meanings.sent5: The battering ram was ramming the castle gate, trying to break it down.

meanings.sent1: She was ramming her clothes into the suitcase before the trip.
meanings.sent2: The students were ramming information into their brains before the exam.
meanings.sent3: The chef was ramming the filling into the pastry, making sure it was full.
meanings.sent4: The overflowing closet was like a ramming contest between clothes.
meanings.sent5: The garbage truck was ramming the trash into its compacting chamber.

meanings.definition: The act of striking or driving with great force
meanings.sent1: The ship's ramming of the iceberg caused it to sink.
meanings.sent2: The ramming of the door with a battering ram broke it open.
meanings.sent3: The ramming of the car into the wall in the movie was just special effects.
meanings.sent4: The ramming of the waves against the cliff eroded it over time.
meanings.sent5: The ramming of the football players during the game was intense.
